com.csvcomparator.methods

Class ColumnMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.csvcomparator.methods.ColumnMethods

  • public class ColumnMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides static methods to do modifications on one ore more columns.
    Author:
    Reto Scheiwiller, 2014

      • merge2ColumnsNoDuplicates

        public static Column merge2ColumnsNoDuplicates(Column olderColumn,
                               Column youngerColumn)
        Merge Columns and remove duplicated Values, decide if the result should be sorted.
        Parameters:
        olderColumn - the Column of the older CSVData
        youngerColumn - the Column of the younger CSVData
        Returns:
        Column - merged column

      • mergeRemoveDuplicatesAndSort

        public static Column mergeRemoveDuplicatesAndSort(Column olderColumn,
                                  Column youngerColumn)
        Merge Columns and remove duplicated Values, and sort the values.
        Parameters:
        olderColumn - the Column of the older CSVData
        youngerColumn - the Column of the younger CSVData
        Returns:
        Column merged and sorted column without duplicates

      • mergeRemoveDuplicatesAndMaintainOrder

        public static Column mergeRemoveDuplicatesAndMaintainOrder(Column olderColumn,
                                           Column youngerColumn)
        Merge Columns and remove duplicated Values, while maintaining the order of the values.
        Parameters:
        olderColumn - the Column of the older CSVData
        youngerColumn - the Column of the younger CSVData
        Returns:
        Column merged Columns without duplicates, maintained order

      • mergeValuesOf2ResultColumns

        public static Column mergeValuesOf2ResultColumns(Column olderResultColumn,
                                 Column youngerResultColumn)
        Merge the Values of 2 Columns.
        If the value in one column is a dash "-*, the value of the other column is used.
        If the value in both column is a dash, "-", a dash will be used in the merged column.
        If both values are not a dassh "-" they will be concatenated with a slash "/" in between.
        Parameters:
        olderResultColumn - the Column of the older CSVData
        youngerResultColumn - the Column of the younger CSVData
        Returns:
        Column - merged Column

      • makeValuesUnique

        public static void makeValuesUnique(Column column)
        Make values unique in one column, the result will be written directly to the column passed to this method. For duplicated values a number like "[1]" will be appended.
        Parameters:
        column - a column with or without duplicated values

      • makeValuesUnique

        public static void makeValuesUnique(Column olderColumn,
                    Column youngerColumn)
        Make values unique for considering two columns This will add a number in both columns, when one column contains the same identifier twice. This will prevent comparison failures when a identifier is used once in one file and multiple times in the other file. The result is applied to the columns passed to the method.
        Parameters:
        olderColumn - the Column of the older CSVData
        youngerColumn - the Column of the younger CSVData

      • multiplyColumnBy

        public static void multiplyColumnBy(Column columnToMultiply,
                    java.lang.String multiplikatorString)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Multiply the column values by the given number, the result will be applied directly to the column passed to this method.
        Parameters:
        columnToMultiply - a column with numerical data which should be multiplied
        multiplikatorString - a string representing a double value
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • divideColumnBy

        public static void divideColumnBy(Column columnToDivide,
                  java.lang.String divisorString)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Divide the column values by the given number, the result will be applied directly to the column passed to this method.
        Parameters:
        columnToDivide - a column with numerical data which should be divided
        divisorString - a string representing a double value
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
